reviews.review_msg: Very difficult readings, but I learned a lot.

No doubt that Elena is smart and knowledgable about her subject matter. But her teaching style is not something I'd prefer. No ppts and involves only discussions. She has no direction to what is being taught, does not reply to emails and is very VERY disorganized.

Absolutely brilliant young prof. Her multidisciplinary background makes it easier to understand the explained themes. She expects students to have read the set readings for the week because she only does a brief overview of the material and then guides discussion; gained so much more from her style than any other discussion centred class. No ppts

Elena, is a really good prof. She is really smart and expects a lot from her students but if you do the work, attend lecture and ask questions she will help you to achieve a good mark. She just wants the best.

This class has been a nightmare! I have tried to get in touch with this professor to learn more about different materials. She takes a very long time to respond. She does not attend lecture. There have been 5 cancelled classes. We have literally only had 2 or 3 classes since the beginning of the semester. Avoid this prof at all costs.

Brilliant and difficult to understand at times.....but a refreshing change from dumbed down professors who cater to the ever-present lazy student who expects knowledge to be handed to them on a  plastic baby plate. You MUST read in her classes, or you will be completely lost!

By far the worst professor I have ever had. Its been 6 weeks since the semester started and we've only had 2 classes so far. She expects us to write a midterm this week and we literally have nothing to study. Bases her teachings purely on opinion from herself and students. Content is extremely vague and very ambiguous. Have learnt nothing so far.

She is so smart and I learned so much.  Probably the first time since arriving to SFU that I actually felt like I got my money's worth.  I learned so much about Aboriginal Issues.  Great, great, great prof!

Elena is an extremely helpful professor.She expects students to do the work required for a third year class.Her marking is fast and fair. Her class structure is great! she encourages discussion and is not like other professors who are too lazy to teach and just want students to ramble on about articles for two hours.She does her job properly!
Helpful if you talk to her, and a fair marker for a third year class.

She sat at the front of the class and read off her mac for up to 4 hours with seemingly no organization. No PPT, no lecture tools, nothing to help make the class engaging. The class started with 40 and ended with 12 with 7 of those threatening academic appeals due to her inconsistent marking. She knows her subject, but cannot teach.

She is a new professor, so yes, a bit disorganized and unsure of herself but actually talk to her and she is very helpful.  She is not a hard marker but she expects you to be at a third year university level and I would say she is rather fair.
Lectures not organized, didn't engage the class enough, and she's a hard marker.
Perhaps a little more structure. Very difficult to feel engaged in the course material.
